p: Eugenol has been reported to protect neuronal cells from excitotoxic and oxidative injury [ 49]. Neuroprotective efficacy of eugenol was also found in acrylamide-induced neuropathy in rats [ 50]. Geraniol showed a neuroprotective effect in an acrylamide model of neurotoxicity in Drosophila melanogaster [ 51]. Additionally, geraniol was reported to be beneficial for the treatment of Parkinsonâ€™s disease associated with neuromuscular disability. These reports further confirmed that eugenol and geraniol played an important role in the neuroprotective effect of O. fragrans var. thunbergii essential oil.
